etymology.description: 言(言) (yán, "words, to speak") + 八(八) (bā, "breath coming from the mouth; divide") + 厃(厃, "danger") = speak too much -> imply prolongation through excessive speech
etymology.interpretation: The character combines elements related to speech and the idea of dividing or emanating breath, suggesting a concept of prolongation through extensive speaking. The presence of 'danger' implies overextension can be harmful.

parts.english: breath coming from the mouth; divide
